text: is a railway station in the city of Murakami, Niigata, Japan, operated by East Japan Railway Company (JR East). ==Lines== Iwafunemachi Station is served by the Uetsu Main Line, and is 55.2 kilometers from the starting point of the line at Niitsu Station. ==Station layout== The station consists of one island platform connected to the station building by a footbridge. The station is unattended. ===Platforms=== ==History== Iwafunemachi Station opened on 1 November 1914. A new station building was completed in 1980. With the privatization of Japanese National Railways (JNR) on 1 April 1987, the station came under the control of JR East. ==Surrounding area== * *former Kamihayashi village hall *Kamihayashi post Office ==See also== * List of railway stations in Japan ==External links== * JR East station information Category:Stations of East Japan Railway Company Category:Railway stations in Niigata Prefecture Category:Uetsu Main Line Category:Railway stations in Japan opened in 1914 Category:Murakami, Niigata
